# Short prompts (max 10 tokens) - for basic embeddings
a kingfisher
a green-winged macaw
a european robin
a mute swan
a great horned owl
a southern cassowary
a scarlet ibis
a african grey parrot
a toucan
a flamingo

# T5-XXL prompts (up to 512 tokens) - detailed descriptions with camera specs
a kingfisher perched on a weathered branch, captured with a Canon EOS R5 paired with EF 600mm f/4L IS III USM lens at f/4, ISO 800, 1/1000s shutter speed, creating a creamy bokeh background. The bird's iridescent turquoise and cobalt blue plumage shimmers in soft natural light, each feather edge catching subtle highlights. Its bright orange breast feathers display fine barring patterns, while the white throat patch contrasts sharply. The long, dagger-like black beak appears razor-sharp. Crown feathers show deep blue-green metallic sheen with individual rachis visible. Wing coverts display intricate patterns of azure and teal spots. The eye is dark and alert with a slight catchlight. Soft golden hour lighting wraps around the subject from the side, creating gentle shadows that define the bird's compact rounded body shape. Background melts into soft circular bokeh orbs in warm amber and cool green tones, completely defocused at the wide f/4 aperture setting.

a green-winged macaw in three-quarter profile, photographed with Nikon D850 and AF-S NIKKOR 500mm f/5.6E PF ED VR lens at f/5.6, ISO 640, 1/800s, producing silky smooth bokeh. The magnificent bird displays its namesake emerald green wing coverts with individual feather edges clearly defined, each plume showing subtle gradations from forest green to lighter lime tones. The scarlet red face and breast feathers appear luminous, with fine texture visible in even lighting. Bright yellow and turquoise facial markings frame the eyes in distinctive patterns. The powerful curved charcoal-grey beak shows fine ridges and texture. Tail feathers cascade down showing bands of crimson, navy blue, and turquoise in layered arrangements. The bare white facial skin displays fine wrinkles and texture. Diffused natural overcast lighting eliminates harsh shadows while maintaining excellent color saturation and feather detail. The background dissolves into creamy neutral bokeh with no distracting elements, achieved through the lens's excellent optical design at f/5.6.

a european robin perched delicately on a mossy twig, captured with Sony α7R V and FE 400mm f/2.8 GM OSS lens at f/2.8, ISO 500, 1/1250s, creating ethereal bokeh separation. The robin's iconic russet-orange breast and face appear warm and soft, with individual feather filaments visible in the gentle directional lighting. The orange plumage shows subtle variations from deep burnt sienna on the margins to lighter peachy tones toward the center. Clean white lower belly feathers contrast with the warm tones above. Soft grey-brown upperparts display subtle olive undertones, with wing coverts showing darker brown edging on each feather. The eye appears large and dark, giving the bird its characteristic gentle expression. Fine grey bill shows slight downward curve. Delicate legs appear flesh-toned and wiry. Soft morning light from a 45-degree angle creates dimension without harsh shadows, beautifully illuminating the orange breast while maintaining detail in darker areas. The extremely wide f/2.8 aperture renders the background as pure creamy bokeh with dreamy circular highlights and no recognizable shapes.

a mute swan gliding gracefully on calm water, photographed with Canon EOS R3 and RF 800mm f/5.6L IS USM lens at f/5.6, ISO 400, 1/1600s, achieving beautiful bokeh compression. The swan's pristine white plumage appears luminous against the soft background, with individual feathers showing subtle texture and layering across the gracefully curved neck. Each feather edge is crisply defined where lit, creating a sense of softness despite the detail. The distinctive orange bill with black knob at the base shows rich color saturation. Black facial markings extend from the bill to the eye in characteristic pattern. The long S-curved neck displays elegant proportions with fine feather detail visible in the natural lighting. Wing feathers remain neatly folded, showing subtle grey shadows between layers that create depth. Reflected light from the water surface provides gentle fill, softening shadows under the neck and body. Even diffused natural lighting reveals the subtle cream undertones in shadow areas of the white plumage. The water surface and distant background blur into soft bokeh with cool blue-grey tones, completely free of distracting elements thanks to the lens's long focal length and f/5.6 aperture combination.

a great horned owl perched majestically on a thick branch, captured with Nikon Z9 and NIKKOR Z 600mm f/4 TC VR S lens at f/4, ISO 1000, 1/640s, producing spectacular bokeh. The owl's distinctive ear tufts stand prominently upward, showing dark brown and tawny barring patterns on individual feathers. The facial disc displays intricate patterns of buff, brown, and white feathers radiating outward from the piercing yellow-orange eyes. Each eye shows incredible detail with the dark pupil and vibrant iris color enhanced by catchlights. White throat patch appears bright and fluffy. The heavily mottled plumage shows complex patterns of dark brown, russet, buff, and cream creating exceptional camouflage texture. Breast feathers display fine horizontal barring, each mark precisely edged. Wing coverts show spotted and barred patterns with remarkable intricacy. The powerful yellow talons grip the branch, each talon and scale visible. Soft directional natural light from the side reveals the three-dimensional quality of the facial disc and creates subtle shadows that emphasize the owl's powerful, robust build. Background renders as smooth bokeh in muted forest tones of soft greens and browns, with no distracting detail at the wide f/4 aperture.

a southern cassowary standing alert, photographed with Sony α1 and FE 400mm f/2.8 GM OSS lens at f/2.8, ISO 640, 1/1000s, creating dreamy bokeh isolation. The bird's distinctive bare blue skin on neck and head shows vivid cerulean coloration with subtle texture and wrinkles visible in the natural lighting. The red wattles hanging from the neck display rich carmine tones with slight translucency where backlit. The tall brown casque atop the head shows rough texture and ridges, appearing almost helmet-like in profile. The body is covered in glossy black plumage with individual hair-like feathers visible, giving a shaggy appearance. Each feather shows a distinctive structure, more like fur than typical bird feathers. The powerful scaled legs appear thick and muscular in blue-grey tones. Sharp dagger-like claws are visible on the large feet. The eye appears small and alert, positioned on the blue facial skin. Soft overcast lighting provides even illumination across the unusual textures without creating harsh shadows on the complex head structure. The extremely wide f/2.8 aperture creates bokeh so smooth the background becomes an abstract wash of soft green and brown tones with beautiful circular highlights, completely isolating this magnificent bird.

a scarlet ibis wading in shallow water, captured with Canon EOS R6 Mark II and RF 600mm f/4L IS USM lens at f/4, ISO 500, 1/1000s, producing lush bokeh. The bird's extraordinary scarlet-red plumage appears almost incandescent, with each feather showing brilliant chrome red coloration that seems to glow in natural light. The uniform red covers the entire body except for black wingtip feathers visible when folded. Individual contour feathers show fine texture and slight variations in red tone from deep crimson to brighter orange-red. The long, decurved pink bill shows a dark tip and smooth gradation of color. Long pink-red legs appear slender and delicate, adapted for wading. The small head is completely covered in red plumage except around the eye. Wing feathers when folded show layered arrangement with each feather precisely positioned. Soft golden hour side-lighting enhances the already vibrant red coloration, creating warm highlights on the curved body surface while maintaining rich color in shadow areas. The water and distant shoreline blur into soft bokeh with cool blue and green tones that beautifully complement the warm red subject, achieved through the lens's excellent optical design at f/4.

an african grey parrot perched on a natural branch, photographed with Nikon D6 and AF-S NIKKOR 500mm f/5.6E PF ED VR lens at f/5.6, ISO 800, 1/500s, creating smooth bokeh separation. The parrot's predominantly grey plumage shows remarkable subtlety, with feather edges appearing slightly lighter creating a scaled appearance across the body. Individual feathers display variations from darker charcoal grey to lighter silver-grey tones. The distinctive bright red tail feathers provide striking contrast, showing brilliant scarlet coloration that appears particularly vivid against the neutral grey body. White facial skin surrounds each eye in characteristic bare patches. The powerful black curved beak appears large and formidable, showing slight texture and a sharp hooked tip. The eye appears pale yellow with dark pupil, giving an intelligent and alert expression. Head feathers show subtle pale edging creating a slightly paler facial appearance. Wing coverts display precise feather arrangement with darker grey flight feathers. The feet and legs appear dark grey with visible scales and powerful curved talons. Soft diffused natural lighting reveals the subtle tonal variations in the grey plumage without washing out the darker areas. Background melts into neutral bokeh in soft warm and cool grey tones, with no distracting elements visible at f/5.6.

a toco toucan perched prominently on a branch, captured with Sony α7R V and FE 600mm f/4 GM OSS lens at f/4, ISO 640, 1/800s, producing gorgeous bokeh. The bird's massive orange bill appears impossibly large, showing bright tangerine coloration with a distinct black oval spot near the tip. The bill shows subtle texture and slight ridging despite its smooth appearance. Black plumage covers most of the body with a slight blue-green sheen visible in direct light. Individual black feathers show fine structure and neat arrangement. The white throat and upper breast patch appears bright and clean, contrasting sharply with surrounding black plumage. The distinctive blue orbital skin surrounds the eye in a striking ring. The eye itself appears dark with a subtle catchlight. Orange-red undertail coverts provide a splash of warm color. The tail appears black and graduated in length. Relatively short legs appear blue-grey with powerful toes and dark curved claws gripping the branch. Soft directional natural light from the side illuminates the enormous bill beautifully, showing its vibrant color and creating subtle shadows that reveal its three-dimensional form. The extremely wide f/4 aperture creates bokeh so smooth that the forest background becomes an abstract blend of soft greens and browns with dreamy circular highlights.

a greater flamingo standing in shallow water, photographed with Canon EOS R5 and EF 800mm f/5.6L IS USM lens at f/5.6, ISO 500, 1/1250s, achieving beautiful bokeh isolation. The bird's characteristic pink plumage shows variations from pale blush on the body to deeper salmon tones on wing coverts. Each feather displays subtle coral and pink hues with slightly darker edges creating texture across the body surface. The distinctive downward-bent bill shows pink coloration with a black tip, displaying the specialized filter-feeding adaptation. The long slender neck curves gracefully in an S-shape, with individual feather patterns visible in natural light. Wing feathers when folded show bands of deep pink and black, with crimson underwing coverts visible at the edges. The extremely long pink legs appear impossibly thin, like stilts, with backward-bending knee joints characteristic of the species. Large webbed feet show pale pink coloration. The small head appears delicate atop the long neck, with a small dark eye. Soft even natural lighting from an overcast sky provides perfect illumination for the pastel pink tones, preventing harsh shadows while maintaining excellent color saturation and subtle detail. The long focal length at f/5.6 renders the water and background into creamy smooth bokeh with soft blue-grey and neutral tones, completely isolating the elegant flamingo form.

# CLIP prompts (up to 77 tokens) - focused descriptions with camera specs
a kingfisher with iridescent turquoise and cobalt blue plumage, bright orange breast feathers, and white throat patch, perched on a branch. Captured with Canon EOS R5 and 600mm f/4 lens at f/4, creating creamy bokeh background. Soft natural lighting highlights metallic sheen on feathers.

a green-winged macaw displaying emerald wing coverts, scarlet red face and breast, yellow and turquoise facial markings, and powerful curved grey beak. Photographed with Nikon D850 and 500mm f/5.6 lens at f/5.6, producing silky smooth bokeh background in diffused natural light.

a european robin with russet-orange breast and face, white lower belly, grey-brown upperparts, and large dark eyes. Captured with Sony α7R V and 400mm f/2.8 lens at f/2.8, creating ethereal bokeh separation with soft morning lighting on delicate form.

a mute swan with pristine white plumage, orange bill with black knob, black facial markings, and gracefully curved neck. Photographed with Canon EOS R3 and 800mm f/5.6 lens at f/5.6, producing beautiful bokeh compression with even natural lighting revealing cream undertones.

a great horned owl with prominent ear tufts, mottled brown plumage, piercing yellow-orange eyes, white throat patch, and intricate facial disc patterns. Captured with Nikon Z9 and 600mm f/4 lens at f/4, creating spectacular bokeh with soft directional natural light.

a southern cassowary with vivid blue neck skin, red wattles, tall brown casque, glossy black hair-like feathers, and powerful blue-grey legs. Photographed with Sony α1 and 400mm f/2.8 lens at f/2.8, producing dreamy bokeh isolation in soft overcast lighting.

a scarlet ibis with brilliant scarlet-red plumage throughout, black wingtip feathers, long decurved pink bill with dark tip, and slender pink legs. Captured with Canon EOS R6 Mark II and 600mm f/4 lens at f/4, creating lush bokeh with golden hour side-lighting.

an african grey parrot with scaled grey plumage, bright red tail feathers, white facial patches, powerful black curved beak, and pale yellow eyes. Photographed with Nikon D6 and 500mm f/5.6 lens at f/5.6, producing smooth bokeh separation in soft diffused natural lighting.

a toco toucan with massive orange bill featuring black spot, black plumage with blue-green sheen, white throat and breast patch, blue orbital skin, and orange-red undertail coverts. Captured with Sony α7R V and 600mm f/4 lens at f/4, creating gorgeous bokeh background.

a greater flamingo with pink plumage, deeper salmon wing coverts, downward-bent pink bill with black tip, gracefully curved neck, and extremely long thin pink legs. Photographed with Canon EOS R5 and 800mm f/5.6 lens at f/5.6, achieving beautiful bokeh isolation.
